instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4652: What is 820-4652? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.
definitions.5V_S4: What is 5V_S4? This is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S4” – when you see this, assume the person typing it meant to type “PP5V_S4”.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4652</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac dont turn on
threads.message:
hi, i am just workin g on this device, no problems to see on the board

first green led is lightning, no reaction by pressing power button

<SIGNAL>PWR_BTN_L</SIGNAL> ckecked

platform reset is still low

i have 3.41V, 3.<SIGNAL>3V_S0</SIGNAL> and 5V s0 and <SIGNAL>12V_S0</SIGNAL>

I dont have <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_REG</SIGNAL>

PP3V?<SIGNAL>V_S5_REG</SIGNAL> is ok

both enable Signals on 7600 are there

replaced already <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>, but no change, checked <RESISTOR>R7656</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7603</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7650</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7672</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7670</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7671</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7659</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7650</RESISTOR> all ok


checked <TRANSISTOR>Q7650</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7655</TRANSISTOR> in diode mode, nothing to find 

no short on L7650 to GND

what else could be the problem in the imac?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4652</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac dont turn on
threads.message:
Please post accurate information!
How do you get <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL> before <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL>???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4652</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac dont turn on
threads.message:
yes, that was for me the intresting part as well.

now i checked again and yes there is no <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL>, but I replaced already <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> inbetween

so I measured bad S4 or bad S5 and have now a bad <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>. I am gonna replace it again and will post the measurements after that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4652</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac dont turn on
threads.message:
I checked now again

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is ok

there is no PP5V-<SIGNAL>S4_REG</SIGNAL>
<CHIP>U7600</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7650</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7655</TRANSISTOR> are replaced already
<SIGNAL>PM_EN_REG_P5V_S4_R</SIGNAL>   (EN2) is 3.3V

it is lighning only the first led from the mainboard

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4652</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac dont turn on
threads.message:
So <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL> is enabled, but not present, check why.

Did you solder new ISL62383C?
Check the solders, R/<CAPACITOR>C7656</CAPACITOR> and al other surrounding components, related with <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL>.
Be sure no short to ground, nor low value at L7650.
